content:
"""
I see the issue - there's not enough space to place the furnace next to the drill. Let's try a different approach:
"""

# First find nearest iron ore patch
iron_pos = nearest(Resource.IronOre)
print(f"Found iron ore at {iron_pos}")

# First place the furnace, then the drill
move_to(iron_pos)
furnace = place_entity(Prototype.StoneFurnace, position=(iron_pos.x + 2, iron_pos.y))
print(f"Placed furnace at {furnace.position}")

# Add fuel to furnace
insert_item(Prototype.Coal, furnace, quantity=5)
print("Added coal to furnace")

# Now place drill
drill = place_entity(Prototype.BurnerMiningDrill, position=iron_pos)
print(f"Placed drill at {drill.position}")

# Add fuel to drill
insert_item(Prototype.Coal, drill, quantity=5)
print("Added fuel to drill")

# Wait for drill to mine
print("Waiting for drill to mine...")
sleep(5)

# Check drill status
print(f"Drill status: {drill.status}")
print(f"Drill drop position: {drill.drop_position}")

# Try to get ore from drill output
move_to(drill.drop_position)
print(f"Moving to drill output at {drill.drop_position}")
extract_item(Prototype.IronOre, drill.drop_position, quantity=5)
print(f"Current inventory: {inspect_inventory()}")

# Move ore to furnace
move_to(furnace.position)
insert_item(Prototype.IronOre, furnace, quantity=5)
print(f"Added ore to furnace. Contents now: {inspect_inventory(furnace)}")

# Wait for smelting
print("Waiting for smelting...")
sleep(10)
print(f"Final furnace contents: {inspect_inventory(furnace)}")

print(f"Setup complete. Entities on map: {get_entities()}")
